title: Trump faces dilemma over military action against Iran
subhead: The US president has pledged support for protesters, but Washington is weighing not only how to intervene, but why: to topple the regime in Tehran, to destroy its repressive apparatus or to force it to surrender on the nuclear issue.

title: Marine Le Pen changes her defense strategy in appeal trial
France records more deaths than births in 2025, a first since World War II
France will inaugurate Greenland consulate in February
subhead: The French foreign minister called the move a 'political signal' over the strategic Danish territory, which US President Donald Trump has vowed to seize.

title: Louvre's higher ticket prices for non-European visitors take effect
subhead: Starting on Wednesday, January 14, any adult visitor from outside the European Union, Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway will have to pay €32 ($37) to enter the Louvre – a 45% increase.

title: 'Nobel Prize for Environment' awarded to specialist in invisible, fascinating and vital mycorrhizal fungi
subhead: Toby Kiers, an American mycologist and evolutionary biologist, won the Tyler Prize for Environmental Achievement for her work on all fronts to raise awareness about the importance of plant-fungi interactions and the urgent need to protect them.

title: 'With Greenland, Trump is seeking a territorial trophy for his personal legacy'
subhead: The threats facing Greenland are testing the European Union, writes the Arctic specialist Cécile Pelaudeix, PhD in political science, arguing the EU must establish regular strategic dialogue with Greenland and Denmark and have the courage to rethink its relationship with the United States.

title: 'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
France slightly improves reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, but remains far from target
Javier Milei's budget cuts criticized after Patagonia fires
Claudette Colvin, US civil rights pioneer, has died at 86
Olympic legends join together to promote official ticket registration for 2028 Games in Los Angeles
US prices remain high, despite Trump's claims of stable inflation
US Supreme Court seems poised to uphold transgender athlete bans
Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
When the US and Venezuela were 'best friends': A four-minute history
US labels Muslim Brotherhood groups in Egypt, Lebanon and Jordan terrorist organizations
'West Wing' actor Timothy Busfield turns himself in, vows to fight child sex abuse charges in New Mexico
Corsican nationalist's assassination spotlights criminals' grip on island
Iran internet blackout: 'The authorities have managed to control the almost sole way out'
subhead: Iran's near-total disconnection from the internet can be explained by a strategy of closely controlling the only gateway for data to enter and leave the country, which the Iranian authorities have pursued for several years.

title: Marine Le Pen returns to court for appeal of graft conviction
subhead: The French far right's leader, sentenced in 2025 to four years in prison and a five-year ban on holding an elected office after being convicted of embezzlement of pubic funds, goes back to court with 11 co-defendants for a one-month trial starting Tuesday.

title: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhead: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

title: France's population decline presents a political challenge
'The trial of Marine Le Pen exposes the fragility of the concept of the rule of law'
2027 French presidential election: A real campaign is needed to slow the far right
